etymologies: mid 19th century (in an earlier sense). From alphabet + -ism, in sense 2 after French alphabétisme

definitions: Representation of spoken sounds by means of letters.

Prejudice or discrimination resulting from a person's position on a (notional) alphabetical list; specifically discrimination against people whose names begin with letters from the latter part of the alphabet.

notes.text: Originally after racism, etc.: see the etymology.
